author: Rachita Prasad
title: Tata Power appoints N Chandrasekaran as Chairman
text:
MUMBAI: Tata Power Company has appointed N Chandrasekaran as the chairman and aditional director of the company with effect from following Tata Sons announcement declaring him the chairman designate, the power utility said in a statement Friday. 

Prior to this, on January 4, Tata Power had appointed S Padmanabhan as the chairman of the company after Cyrus Mistry resigned from the post following his ouster from Tata Sons. 

“I am honoured to be appointed as the chairman of the board of this historic organisation which has been serving the nation for the past 100 years with dedication. It will be my endeavor to help the management team fulfil Tata Power’s commitment to light up the lives of our future generations,” said Chandrasekaran. He is currently chief executive officer and managing director of Tata Consultancy Services, where he joined in 1987. 

In December, Tata Power brought back S Padmanabhan, who has been with the group for 34 years and was executive director of operations at the company until 2014, as an additional director on the board. He is also the executive chairman of Tata Business Excellence Group and has also been recently appointed as the head of group for human resources for Tata Sons. 

Tata Power had called for an extra ordinary general meeting of shareholders to take up the removal of Cyrus Mistry as the chairman on December 26 but Mistry rendered a resignation before that on December 19.
